datafield.subfield: Scale 1:63,360 (one inch to a statute mile).
46.5 x 77 cm. or smaller, on 21 sheets 57 x 80 cm. or smaller.
Surveyed by C.R.Conder & H.H.Kitchener, 1878. Reproduced by the Survey of Egypt, 1917-1918.
The Albright library has 2 copies of sheets XVII [Jerusalem] and XVIII [Jericho].
Sheet 16 and the duplicates of 17 and 18 have had their margins cut away.

The sheets are untitled, but titles have been added in manuscript. Sheets: I [Tyre] -- III [Acre] -- IV [Safed] -- V [Haifa] -- VII & VIII [Jenin] -- IX [Beisan] -- X [Kfar Saba] -- XI [Nablus] -- XII [Tubas] -- XIII [Jaffa] -- XIV [Shiloh] -- XV [Akrabeh] -- [XVI Ashdod] -- XVII [Jerusalem] -- XVIII [Jericho] -- XIX [Gaza] -- XXI [Hebron] -- XXII [Ein Gedi] -- XXIII [Wady Shuzzeh] -- Parts of XXIII, XXIV, XXV [Beersheba] -- XXVI-XXVI [Tel Arad].
May require conservation work before use.
Digitized version, photography by Ardon Bar-Hama courtesy of George Blumenthal, also available online on the AIAR website. See sheet links at:
Digitized version also available from the Albright CD collection (GA1321.B3).

Sheet sizes: I, 57 x 40 cm.; III, 71 x 56 cm.; IV, 71 x 56 cm.; V, 71 x 56 cm.; VII/VIII, 78 x 57 cm.; IX, 71 x 54 cm.; X, 56 x 39 cm.; XI, 71 x 57 cm.; XII, 71 x 57 cm.; XIII, 71 x 57 cm.; XIV, 71 x 57 cm.; XV, 71 x 57 cm.; XVI, 66 x 52 cm.; XVII, 71 x 57 cm.; XVIII, 73 x 56 cm.; XIX, 71 x 57 cm.; XXI, 71 x 57 cm.; XXII, 73 x 57 cm.; XXIII, 73 x 57 cm.; XXIII/XXIV/XXV, 80 x 57 cm.; XXVI-XXVI, 79 x 56 cm.

117 (sh. I); 118 (sh. III); 119 (sh. IV); 362 (sh. V); 120 (sh. VII, VIII); 121 (sh. IX); 122 (sh. X); 123 (sh. XI); 124 (sh. XII); 125 (sh. XIII); 126 (sh. XIV); 127 (sh. XV); 381 (sh. [XVI); 128, [c. 1 363] (sh. XVII); 47 [c. 1 383] (sh. XVIII); 46 (sh. XIX); 382 (sh. XXI); 48 (sh. XXII); 49 (sh. XXIII); 97 (sh. XXIII, XXIV, XXV); 50 (sh. XXVI-XXVI).
